text: "God Bless Latvia" is the national anthem of Latvia. The words of the song was written in 1873 by a Latvian composer named Kārlis Baumanis. The tune, which he had also composed himself, is similar to that of British anthem "God Save the King". It became the national anthem of the Baltic country in 1920.Dzintra Stelpe (2009). Lielā Latvijas Enciklopēdija. Riga: Zvaigzne ABC. p. 263. ISBN 9789984408095. OCLC 644036298. ==Lyrics== Words of the song in Latvian Words of the song using an older Latvian spelling Pronunciation of these words using the IPA Words of the song in English 𝄆 Dievs, svētī Latviju! Mūs’ dārgo tēviju Svētī jel Latviju Ak, svētī jel to! 𝄇 𝄆 Kur latvju meitas zied Kur latvju dēli dzied Laid mums tur laimē diet Mūs’ Latvijā!http://www.likumi.lv/doc.php?id=47134 Par Latvijas valsts himnu. Retrieved 27 May 2007. Published by Latvijas Vēstnesis on 5 March 1998. 𝄇 𝄆 Deewſ, ſwehtie Latwiju! Muhſ’ dahrgo tehwiju ſwehtie jel Latwiju Ak, ſwehtie jel to! 𝄇 𝄆 Kur latwju meitaſ seed Kur latwju dehli zeed Laid mumſ tur laimeh deet Muhſ’ Latwijah! 𝄇 𝄆 [djæʊ̯s ǀ sʋɛː.tiː ɫɑt.ʋi.ju ‖] [muːz‿dɑːr.guɔ̯ tɛː.ʋi.ju ǀ] [sʋɛː.tiː jɛɫ ɫɑt.ʋi.ju ǀ] [ɑk sʋɛː.tiː jɛɫ tuɔ̯ ‖] 𝄇 𝄆 [kur ɫɑt.ʋju mɛɪ̯.tæz‿zjæd ǀ] [kur ɫɑt.ʋju dɛː.ɫi d͡zjæd ǀ] [ɫɑɪ̯d mu(m)s tur ɫɑɪ̯.mɛː djæt ǀ] [muːz‿ɫɑt.ʋi.jɑː ‖] 𝄇 God bless Latvia! Our homeland grand and dear, O, exalt Latvia! O, bless it once more! Where Latvian daughters bloom, Where Latvian sons hum, There let us gleam for charm, In our Latvia! ==References== Category:1870s songs Category:European anthems Category:National symbols of Latvia
title: Dievs, svētī Latviju!
